examples: Many people never do any exercise.
We've invited 30 people to our party.

body_content.explanation: used to refer to everyone, or informally to the group that you are speaking to:
examples: People will think you've gone mad.
People like to be made to feel important.
Now that we've discussed our problems, are people happy with the decisions we've made?

body_content.explanation: men and women who are involved in a particular type of work:
examples: We'll have to get the people at the city council to look at these plans.
Most of her friends are media people.

body_content.explanation: the large number of ordinary men and women who do not have positions of power in society:
examples: She claims to be the voice of the people.
The president has lost the support of the people.

body_content.explanation: the people someone is related to:
examples: Her people come from Scotland originally.
I prefer to live with my people.
His people have been in the fishing industry for generations.
Where do your people come from originally?
We married and I moved to live with her people.

body_content.explanation: all the men, women, and children who live in a particular country, or who have the same culture or language:
examples: The French are known as a food-loving people.
Customs similar to this one are found among many peoples of the world.
